metadata.title: 4 Easy Ways You Can Improve Your Data Science Career | Towards Data Science
metadata.h1: 4 Easy Ways You Can Improve Your Data Science Career
metadata.description: 4 easy ways you can improve your Data Science career. Meeting with a mentor, joining a club, online coursework, attending a webinar, and Machine Learning.

outgoing_paragraph_urls.anchor_text: Artificial Intelligence: Strategies for Leading Business Transformation

all_paragraphs: There are several ways and paths that one can take to improve upon their Data Science career. Some are more technical-oriented while some are more business-oriented. I will be discussing some of the ways that you can easily improve upon your Data Science career with specific use cases. These improvements include mentorship, online coursework, Data Science clubs, and webinars. A combination of these can surely give you the edge as a Data Scientist in an extremely competitive market. Please continue reading if you would like to learn more about the ways to be the best Data Scientist that you can be.

The first point is taking a proactive approach to reaching out to a leader in Data Science. It can be as simple as your Manager at your current role, or a top voice from LinkedIn for example. If you are in your first year or first years in Data Science, you can become overwhelmed with the different types of skills required to be a competitive Data Scientist. Having a mentor helps to alleviate some of the anxiety of this situation. You can reach out to them and develop a relationship where you can feel comfortable asking questions that may seem simple but end up being extremely critical in your quality of work.

Also important is that if you are just starting off in your career, having a mentor for your capstone project at your university is beneficial for getting exposure to that first real-world Data Science experience.
Here are some of the benefits of meeting with a mentor:

As you can see, a lot of these benefits include learning. Having a mentor will allow you to learn so much, rather that be from common Data Science mistakes, or presenting and discussing difficult topics in Machine Learning to another person. I highly recommend finding someone you are comfortable talking with so you can become a better Data Scientist who is always eager to learn and grow. Perhaps you can teach them something as well, which will ultimately help you learn that respective topic in Data Science.

Similar to meeting with a mentor is joining a Data Science club. There are virtual clubs that I have become a part of that serve as a community where I could find several mentors. You can benefit from hearing from others in the Data Science community. LinkedIn is a great place to find others who are interested in emerging Machine Learning algorithms. Some other places to meet others include Kaggle, various universities, and online courses where you can meet with and develop your own club. I have found a lot of alumni from my alma mater and we have become not only Data Science acquaintances, but also friends.
Here are some of the benefits of joining a Data Science club:
There are several other benefits as well, but above are some of the ones that I have experienced from joining several different Data Science clubs.

Countless courses and certifications have arisen because of current events, therefore, it is important and useful to cover a couple of the top variations of these certificates so that you can learn and apply your best Data Science knowledge wherever you are. These courses and certifications are from highly reputable universities so it can be attested that beyond my recommendation, there are others as well that support these programs.

In these programs, you will learn how to become a better Data Scientist through business leadership learnings. You will focus on anything from Python to sharing insights with stakeholders. A majority of these courses also offer content from use cases, which is critical in applying real-world projects to your everyday current or future career as a business leader.
I will be raising and answering four main questions for each of these certificates to better summarize, including:

There is a cost for these so if you are looking for other free options, I will have that information linked down below. Also important to expand upon is that these are not only certifications but courses as well (certificates can sometimes imply that you only take an exam without a course). These courses and certificates from these two universities will help you to become a better Data Scientist as well as a business leader in both Data Science and Artificial Intelligence. I am affiliated with these universities so I will receive a payment if you enroll in either of these two courses— please continue on to the ‘attending a webinar’ section or refer to the linked article at the end of this article if you would like to hear more free courses instead.

This course is for senior leaders, senior managers, and C-suite executives. The focus of this course is on the overseeing integration of AI into a company’s business strategy. So if you want to explore AI and its incorporation into your company, then this course is for you.
What are the stats on this course?
What are the key learnings and assignments?
— neural networks and deep learning
— computer vision and NLP (Natural Language Processing)
A unique part of this course is the Capstone Business Challenge Project. You will go over a business case and plan that works with AI to transform one part of your business.

This type of learning is as close as it gets with real-world application, but you will benefit from having instructors who can guide you and put you on the correct path to make the biggest impact with AI in your business.
Here is the link to this course [5]:
Northwestern University | Kellogg School of Management

This program is for C-level executives, presidents, vice presidents, and senior managers of their business. There is a focus on functional leaders who want to better understand AI, with a specific tier aimed at investment in venture capital, private equity, or hedge funds that want to understand AI investments.
What are the stats on this course?
What are the key learnings and assignments?
— AI trends, tools, and applications
— customer experience management with AI
— business support functions with AI

This course has more than 50 business use cases which are quite unique and beneficial. This feature is complemented by data labs with real-world datasets. They stress the importance of developing your AI playbook as well, from major companies like Microsoft, Facebook, and Airbnb. Some examples of learnings from these business use cases include, but are not limited to: minimizing cost and disruption of services for customers, advertisements and predicting clicks, as well as developing a smart pricing system — all of which are incredibly valuable learnings.
Here is the link to this course [6]:

While I would normally say join an in-person conference, current events have halted this type of experience, but that does not mean there is another way to enjoy learning from others. Attending a webinar or online conference is extremely beneficial to you in your career for some of the same reasons as the points from above. You will learn from others around you, examine new and upcoming Machine Learning algorithms, and learn more efficient ways of computing certain Data Science problems.
Here are some of the benefits of attending a webinar:

One of the conferences I really enjoyed was the Data Science Salon (I am not affiliated with this conference). Here is the link [8] to their website if you would like to learn more about their schedule and presenters.

Where mentorship and joining a Data Science club can be somewhat more personal and recurring, attending a webinar or conference in Data Science, can allow you to learn from more prominent voices in the Data Science community. These events also serve as ways to hear from not just the top people in Data Science, but also the top companies in Data Science. Ultimately, all of these learnings and relationships will help you to become a better Data Scientist.

As you can see, there are several ways and paths to becoming a better Data Scientist. Whether that be from learning from a mentor, learning from others in a Data Science club, performing applicable coursework, or watching webinars and conferences, you will find value in any and all of these, allowing you to improve upon your Data Science career.
Thank you for reading my article, and feel free to comment down below your experience with these ways of improving your Data Science career.
Here is a link to my other article on some free courses that take a shorter amount of time to complete of which I also recommend [9]:
